MAN.TITLE: interp

PARAM_DESCRIPTION.SP: : real vectors of the same size defining a cubic spline or sub-spline function (called s in the following)
: (optionnal) string defining the evaluation of s outside the [x1,xn] interval
: vector or matrix of same size than xp, elementwise evaluation of s on xp (yp(i)=s(xp(i) or yp(i,j)=s(xp(i,j))
: vectors (or matrices) of same size than xp, elementwise evaluation of the successive derivatives of s on xp

DESCRIPTION.P: Given three vectors (x,y,d) defining a spline or sub-spline function (see splin) with yi=s(xi), di = s'(xi) this function evaluates s (and s', s'', s''' if needed) at xp(i) :
DESCRIPTION.VERBATIM: yp(i) = s(xp(i)) or yp(i,j) = s(xp(i,j)) yp1(i) = s'(xp(i)) or yp1(i,j) = s'(xp(i,j)) yp2(i) = s''(xp(i)) or yp2(i,j) = s''(xp(i,j)) yp3(i) = s'''(xp(i)) or yp3(i,j) = s'''(xp(i,j))
DESCRIPTION.P: The out_mode parameter set the evaluation rule for extrapolation, i.e. for xp(i) not in [x1,xn] :

ITEM.label: "by_zero"
ITEM.SP: : an extrapolation by zero is done

ITEM.label: "C0"
ITEM.SP: : the extrapolation is defined as follows :
ITEM.VERBATIM: s(x) = y1 for x < x1 s(x) = yn for x > xn

ITEM.label: "natural"
ITEM.SP: : the extrapolation is defined as follows (p_i being the polynomial defining s on [x_i,x_{i+1}]) :
ITEM.VERBATIM: s(x) = p_1(x) for x < x1 s(x) = p_{n-1}(x) for x > xn

ITEM.label: "linear"
ITEM.SP: : the extrapolation is defined as follows :
ITEM.VERBATIM: s(x) = y1 + s'(x1)(x-x1) for x < x1 s(x) = yn + s'(xn)(x-xn) for x > xn
